free.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: something that is free does not cost you any money
free.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Admission is free for children under 9.
All students are offered free accommodation.
Send for our free information pack for more details.
There’s a special free gift with this month’s magazine.
free.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: not held, tied up, or kept somewhere as a prisoner
free.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He knew he could be free in as little as three years.
With one leap he was free!
He walked out of the courtroom a free man.
They have called on the government to set all political prisoners free.
He was found not guilty and walked free from the court.
The animals are allowed to run free in the park.
Hundreds of dogs roam free on the streets.
She broke free from her attacker.
free.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: allowed to do or say whatever you want, or allowed to happen, without being controlled or restricted by anyone or anything
free.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: We had a free and open discussion about religion.
He became president following the country’s first free elections last year.
We would all support the principle of free speech.
For the first time in its history, the country has a free press.
Patients are now allowed free access to their medical records.
The legislation will allow the free movement of goods through all the countries in Europe.
Remember, you are free to say no.
Newspapers today are entirely free from government control.
Women are struggling to break free from tradition.
I longed to be free of my family.
free.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: if you are free, or have some free time, you have no work, and nothing else that you must do
free.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Children these days have very little free time.
I haven’t got a free day this week.
Are you free for lunch tomorrow?
At last I was free to concentrate on my own research.
free.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: something that is free is available to use because it is not already being used
free.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: I’m afraid we don’t have any free tables this evening.
He used his free hand to open the door.
free.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: At last she was free of pain.
A lot of the patients are now free from symptoms.
free.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: All our drinks are free from artificial colourings.
free.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: if something is free of tax, you do not have to pay tax on it
free.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: an opportunity to buy duty-free goods
This income should be free of tax.
free.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: something that is free is not held, blocked, or restricted
free.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: We opened both doors to allow a free flow of air through the building.
free.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: a free chemical substance is not combined with any other substance
free.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: the amount of free oxygen in the atmosphere
free.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: something that is free does not cost you any money
Parking is free after 6 pm.
‘How much is it to get into the concert?’ ‘Oh, I think it’s free.’
They were giving away free tickets for the concert.
I’m saving these tokens to get a free poster.
for nothing/for free
without having to pay for something that you would normally have to pay for
He offered to fix the car for nothing.
Fans were allowed into the stadium for nothing as a way of celebrating.
Children under five can see the show for free.
at no extra cost
if a shop or company provides an additional service at no extra cost, they do it without asking you for any more money
The shop will install the cooker for you at no extra cost.
Tours of the city are available from the hotel at no extra cost.
complimentary
free – use this about things that a company, theatre, hotel etc gives people
Karen’s sister works at the New York Ballet and she’s managed to get us some complimentary tickets.
Honeymooners receive a complimentary bottle of champagne  in their hotel room.
be on the house
if food or drinks are on the house, the owner of a bar or restaurant says you do not have to pay for them
These drinks are on the house.
gratis
without having to pay for something
Users will be able to listen to tracks  (=songs)gratis.
free.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to allow someone to leave prison or somewhere they have been kept as a prisoner
free.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He expects to be freed quite soon.
The terrorists have at last agreed to free the hostages.
She was freed from prison last week.
free.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to allow someone to say and do what they want, after controlling or restricting them in the past
free.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The press has now been freed from political control.
She longed to be freed of her responsibilities.
free.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to move someone or something so that they are no longer held, fixed, or trapped
free.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: He struggled to free himself, but the ropes were too tight.
I couldn’t free the safety catch.
All the victims have now been freed from the wreckage.
free.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to stop someone suffering from something by removing it
free.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: new drugs that can free people from pain
At last the country has been freed from its enormous debts.
free.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: to make something available so that it can be used
free.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: I need to free up some of the disk space on my computer.
This should free some money for investment.
free.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: to give someone time to do something by taking away other jobs that they have to do
free.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: Taking away the burden of administration will free teachers to concentrate on teaching.
We have freed up some staff to deal with the backlog of work.
free.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Children under four can travel free.
You can get advice free from your local library.
All these services are available to the public free of charge.
He offered to do the work for free.
free.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: not fixed or held in a particular place or position
free.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: The ropes were now hanging free.
A gold chain swung free around his neck.
free.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a free transfer; the process by which a player moves from one football club to another, but the new club does not pay any money for him
free.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: We got Kevin on a free from Manchester United.
free.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: without something that you do not want
free.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: They live in the house rent-free.
free.translation[5].definitions[0].defin: without something, often something that you do not want
free.translation[5].definitions[0].examp: Earnings will be tax-free if the money remains on deposit for seven years.
Heathrow Airport gets more money from duty-free sales than from landing fees.
The casino will generate $10 million a year in risk-free income for the consortium.
free.translation[6].definitions[0].examp: First-class passengers will have four films to choose from, all of them free.
Like pizza, Chinese food is more expensive than hamburgers and can bear the cost of free delivery.
In order to attract new members, the gym decided to offer a week’s free trial.
free.translation[6].definitions[1].defin: used to say that something may seem to be free, but that in fact somebody must pay for it
free.translation[6].definitions[1].examp: The economic principle of ‘no free lunch’ applies — people get the services they pay for.
There’s no such thing as a free lunch. If you receive ‘free’ shares, you’re bound to pay for them in other ways.
free.translation[6].definitions[2].defin: without something, usually something that you do not want
free.translation[6].definitions[2].examp: The economy remains slow but relatively free of inflation.
The interest on savings bonds is free from state and local tax.
Personal Equity Plans, which have a £6,000 investment limit each financial year, arefree of income tax and capital gains tax.
free.translation[6].definitions[3].examp: Privatization is important, but the main condition for a market economy is free prices.
The company is free to impose whatever work rules and pay it chooses.
free.translation[7].definitions[0].examp: More prices, including that of milk, will be freed from state control.
free.translation[7].definitions[1].defin: to make something available so that it can be used
free.translation[7].definitions[1].examp: Ford said the sale of its heavy truck unit will free resources to concentrate on its light and medium truck business.
The government have freed up several million dollars of federal money that was reserved for development but never spent.
free.translation[8].definitions[0].examp: Senior citizens can travel free at off-peak times.
This service is available to the public free of charge.
The downloads are available for free from their website.
